question.body: If you wanted to maintain the strength of a bone, but lower the chance it would break when bent, which of the following would you change?

multiple_choice.choice: Increase the number of osteons; decrease the number of trabeculae
Increase the number of trabeculae; decrease the number of osteons
Increase the amount of compact bone
Decrease the amount of spongy bone

response.feedback: Incorrect. Osteons will add a lot of strength but they make the bone very brittle and do not handle bending pressure as well as the trabeculae.
Correct. The trabeculae are like beams in concrete. They add strength and allow for some flexibility, allowing bone to withstand stresses from different directions.
Incorrect. Compact bone is composed of osteons which add strength but make the bone brittle.
Incorrect. Spongy bone contains trabeculae which provides more flexibility and strength to bone. Decreasing this type of bone would make bone more likely to break when bent.

part.hint: Osteons make the bones stronger and more brittle, so they break more easily when bent.
Trabeculae are found in Spongy bone, Osteons are found in compact bone.
